title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, goals, and requirements for the DeepSeaExplorer system. Gather input from stakeholders, subject matter experts, and potential users.

title: System Architecture Design for DeepSeaExplorer
description: Design the overall architecture of the DeepSeaExplorer system, including components for autonomous navigation, specimen collection, data processing, and communication with surface vessels. Consider fault tolerance, scalability, real-time data processing requirements, integration with existing systems or standards used in deep-sea exploration (e.g., IEEE 1451, OPC UA), and outline a plan for testing and validation of the architecture design. This task includes creating system diagrams to visually represent the proposed architecture. To ensure a robust and efficient design, it is essential to consult with relevant experts (e.g., frontend-developer, backend-developer, database-specialist, devops-engineer) throughout the process. Incorporate feedback from the Security Specialist for secure data handling and communication, and collaborate closely with them during the design process. Additionally, consult with the Project Manager to ensure alignment with project objectives and milestones. Include performance optimization strategies in the design to meet real-time processing requirements. Once the design is complete, assign task decomposer for further decomposition into smaller tasks as needed. Update the status to READY_FOR_DECOMPOSITION.

title: Navigation and Control System
description: Develop the AI algorithms and software components for autonomous navigation and control of the deep-sea exploration robots.

title: Specimen Collection and Processing
description: Implement the functionality for collecting and processing specimens from the deep-sea environment.

title: Data Management and Storage for DeepSeaExplorer: RFC Review
description: This document proposes a design for a robust data management and storage system for the DeepSeaExplorer project. The system will include data organization, backup mechanisms, access control, retrieval strategies, and implementation of an efficient specimen database. (Currently in Progress, assigned to code-architect)

title: User Interface and Visualization
description: Develop a user-friendly interface and data visualization tools for monitoring and controlling the exploration robots and analyzing the collected data.

title: System Integration and Testing
description: Integrate the various components of the DeepSeaExplorer system and conduct thorough testing, including unit tests, integration tests, and system tests.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Ensure the DeepSeaExplorer system adheres to relevant security standards and regulatory compliance requirements.

title: Deployment and Operations
description: Plan and implement the deployment strategy for the DeepSeaExplorer system, including infrastructure provisioning, monitoring, and maintenance.

title: Documentation and Training
description: Develop comprehensive documentation for the DeepSeaExplorer system, including user manuals, technical specifications, and training materials.
